DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , placebo-controlled trial Thai pregnancy conduct . The study aim determine whether vitamin D3 1,800 IU/d supplementation lactate mother improve vitamin D status breastfed infant .
DOC.detailed_description: Vitamin D deficiency pregnancy increase risk gestational diabetes mellitus , pre-eclampsia , preterm birth , low birth weight cesarean section . To adverse event , vitamin D supplementation pregnancy lactation recommend , dose range vary . Then , study carry lactate mother breastfed infant maternal 25 Hydroxy-vitamin D ( 25OHD ) level 10-30 ng/ml third trimester . Subjects divide 2 group , one randomly assign 1,800 IU/d compare maternal infant control receive placebo . Maternal serum 25OHD milk VitD measure LC-MS/MS lactation , cord blood 6 week breastfed infant . This study submit ethical consideration relevant Ethics committee .
DOC.criteria: Pregnant Thai woman intend deliver Rajavithi Hospital Insufficient Vitamin D level ( 25 ( OH ) D < 30ng/ml ) Gestational age birth complication Age < 18 year old Unintended deliver Rajavithi Hospital Insufficient Vitamin D level ( 25 ( OH ) D < 10ng/ml )
